Function.Description: The balance function locates the sub-string (if any) of the source string {sourceString}, starting at the specified displacement {startPos}, that is enclosed by parentheses.

Brief.Overview: The balance function locates the sub-string (if any) of the source string {sourceString}, starting at the specified displacement {startPos}, that is enclosed by parentheses. If the specified source start location is not enclosed by parentheses, the balance function returns the Boolean value false.
Brief.Usage: Since the Lisp language is heavily (like all Lisp dialects) involved with matching open and close parentheses, this function can be used often during automated Script editing.

Argument.Name: sourceString
Argument.Note: Source String that contains a Lisp expression

Argument.Name: startPos
Argument.Note: An integer value that represents the starting position to determine if the expression is balanced.

Syntax.Return: If the specified source string starting at the specified position, is balanced, then the return value is the substring containing the balanced expression. If the string is not balanced, then the Boolean value false is returned.
